results.title: Smart footwork
results.creator_credit: Renown Pictures, Palfreeman Film Productions and Toby Carpenter
results.brief_description: It is said that a man spends half of his life in his shoes, yet gives them less thought than any other article of apparel. Here in this film we watch the process of manufacture of footwear in a British factory, starting with the evil-smelling tannery where the hides are treated, and ending wiht someone’s feet in a smart pair of finished shoes. The film shows also examples of footwear worn as long ago as the 15th century, and watch master craftsmen at work on hand-made shoes.

results.title: Smallpox: merciless traveller
results.creator_credit: Czechoslovak Film Studios, World Health Organisation and Vaclav Bedrich
results.brief_description: This animated film deals with the history of smallpox throughout the ages. Shows how it has ravaged the world from the time of the Pharoahs, the discovery of a vaccine by Edward Jenner and his fight to have it recognised by international medical authorities and how the smallpox problem is being dealt with in the present day.

results.title: Small world = Le Monde est petit
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Unesco and Jacques Valentin
results.brief_description: Children from some forty countries were asked to give their interpretation in drawings of the world from pre-history to the year 3000 AD. This film, made within the framework of UNESCO’s project for the mutual understanding of Orient and Occident, shows that the imagination of children knows no frontiers.

results.title: Small soldiers
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, NBCUniversal, Colin Wilson, Michael Finnell and Joe Dante
results.brief_description: When defence industry firm Globotech takes over the small toy company Heartland Play Systems, it makes for some interesting merging of ideas. New CEO Gil Mars (Denis Leary) approves an enhancement to current action figures to make them look more realistic, and gives the task to Heartland employees Larry Benson (Jay Mohr) and Irwin Wayfair (David Cross). This results in the creation of some serious looking fighting figures, appropriately called the Command Elite who wage a constant war against the alien Gorgonites. As a final measure, Benson inserts some of Globotech’s powerful military computer chips into the new toys. In a run down toy store in Ohio, a father and son get to see the new product and decide it’s just what they need to boost their failing business. The son learns to communicate with the leader of the Gorgonites, Archer (voice supplied by Frank Langella), which has serious consequences for their future. It’s not long before the Command Elite burst forth from their packing, led by Chip Hazard (voice supplied by Tommy Lee Jones), ready as ever to do battle with the Gorgonites. When Chip sees the Gorgonite leader communicating with humans, it results in an all out war between the Command Elite and humans in a fantastic mix of live action, animatronics, puppetry and computer animation. Voices from Robert Aldrich’s ‘The Dirty Dozen’ are provided as some of the voices of the Command Elite. Cast also includes Kirsten Dunst and Gregory Smith. Features a tribute to Phil Hartman after the closing credits.

results.title: Small smoke at Blaze Creek
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, George Pearson and Michael Scott
results.brief_description: Forest fire in mountainous British Columbia, as experienced by the men who must try to quench it from the air and at close quarters on the ground. Over half of fire outbreaks occur through carelessness, and this film affords a close, vivid view of the result: a whole mountainside turned into a searing, crackling holocaust until nothing remains but grey, desolate waste—mute reproach to all who travel or work in the forests. (Awards: Berlin; Belgrade.)

results.title: Small Scale Vegetable Growing
results.brief_description: James Murison, Australian horticulturist, presents a comprehensive guide from site selection to long term storage of your vegetable crop and includes information on soil testing, drainage, fertilisers, pest and disease control and crop rotation.

results.title: Small pond : funky frogs collect stamps
results.brief_description: This is a short promotional video made to explain the story behind the Australia Post ‘Small pond’ stamp collection. Designers of the stamps describe how they came up with their ideas and designs, as well as a short description of the animals depicted on the stamps. It gives a brief explanation of how important the study/research of frogs is to understanding out natural environment.

results.title: Small planet
results.creator_credit: United Nations and International Civil Aviation Organization
results.brief_description: Jet planes in civil aviation and the services provided by ICAO. The types of jet in use; the elaborate ground services they require; the role of ICAO in studying civil aviation needs, coordinating services and supplying financial and technical asistance. Stresses the shrinkage of distance and the growth of cooperation through air travel.

results.title: Small people
results.brief_description: The fun and fascination of puppetry. Based on the work of Edith Munay, who pioneered the teaching of puppetry to Australian children. The wide range of interest includes the puppets to make, their clothes, the story to be thought of, the play to be worked out, the manipulation, the gestures and voices of the characters; glove puppets, animal puppets, rod puppets and marionettes, all are shown in this introduction to puppetry.

results.title: Small pebbles on a giant shore
results.creator_credit: Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Maria Stratford
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Describes problems of disabled non-English speaking immigrants in Australia. Shows how some of these special groups have received assistance through the help of ADEC (Action on Disability within Ethnic Communities).
